conclusion: Consider principles of light and shadow in 3D space.
The light source is currently positioned in the front left of the scene.
When the light source moves to the back right, it will cast shadows in the opposite direction.
Object B is a white sheet of paper.
Object C is a chicken leg.
The shadow of an object is formed by the light source and the object itself.
The shadow will move in the opposite direction of the light source.
The shadow of an object will be cast on the ground, and its size will depend on the distance from the light source and the size of the object.
The shadow of the apple will move to the back right.
The shadow of the white sheet of paper will move to the back right.
The shadow of the chicken leg will move to the back right.
The shadow of the glass will move to the back right.
The shadows of all the objects will move to the back right.
